page.title: 03HANGMANS WOOD, GRAYS
page.content: Hangmans Wood is on a ridge above the Thames river.It is in an angle formed by the A1013 to Southend and the A1089 going to Chadwell St. Mary.The name 'Hangmans Wood' suggests that people were hanged in the wood,but there is no record of any such events.The name is also thought to come from the fact that the trees seemed to hang over the river.The wood may have first been called Hanging Wood but over the years changed to Hangmans Wood. The wood is about four acres big and consists of deciduous trees. Another feature of the wood is the presence of {deneholes.}There are three remaining ones which are fenced for safety, and several more which have been filled in.
